definition: preliminary hearing/interrogation (of a suspect)/preliminary examination (of a project etc)

sentences.english: Only the Pre-Trial Chamber has the authority to issue arrest warrants or summonses.
sentences.chinese: 只有预审庭有权力发布拘捕证或传票。

sentences.english: After the user selects the cost, the next level of appropriate preapprovers is displayed.
sentences.chinese: 用户选择成本之后，将显示下一级别的相应预审批人。

sentences.english: Prequalification enables the employer to establish, in advance, the competence of firms.
sentences.chinese: 资格预审能使雇主提前确定公司的实力。

sentences.english: Being pre-qualified gives you a general idea of how much you can afford to borrow.
sentences.chinese: 参加资格预审可以让你大致了解自己能够贷款多少。
世卫组织对疫苗进行了资格预审。

sentences.english: Subsequent to indictments and arrests, the examining magistrate deals with the individual cases.
sentences.chinese: 继起诉和逮捕之后，预审法官开始处理个案。
每个买家通过资格预审的。

sentences.english: What factors does the Pre-Trial Chamber consider in making its decision on the arrest warrant?
sentences.chinese: 在做拘捕证决定时，预审庭考虑什么因素？

sentences.english: Now, we are seeing both parties being involved even at the pre-transaction stage.
sentences.chinese: 目前，即使在预审阶段，我们都是双方共同参与。

sentences.english: Why does WHO run the Prequalification of Medicines Programme?
sentences.chinese: 为什么世卫组织要实施药品资格预审规划？

sentences.english: Abstract: Prequalification is the first key step that the construction enterprises strive for project implementation.
sentences.chinese: 资格预审是施工企业争取项目实施权的的“入门仗”。

sentences.english: A vaccine for Japanese encephalitis which will be submitted shortly to WHO for prequalification.
sentences.chinese: 一种日本脑炎的疫苗，它即将提交世界卫生组织预审。

sentences.english: Only products included in an EOI are eligible for prequalification.
sentences.chinese: 只有列入意向书的产品才有资格接受资格预审。

sentences.english: Pre-trial judge system does not fit China.
sentences.chinese: 我国不宜引进预审法官制度。

sentences.english: Bidder pre-qualification inquiry is adopted in this bidding process.
sentences.chinese: 本次招标采用资格预审方式。

definition: to report for judgment/to submit for approval
to reconsider/to reexamine/to review (e.g. a report prior to accepting it)
to report for criticism/to submit for approval to higher authority
to accept to hear a case/to handle (a service)
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
joint hearing/to review jointly (i.e. with other checkers)
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
to review a judicial case/to reexamine
